title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Republican John Deaton announces bid for Sen. Ed Markey's seat in 2026 after losing to Elizabeth Warren.
Deaton highlights his background as a Marine and contrasts his youth with Markey's long political career.
Markey faces primary challenge from Rep. Seth Moulton amid reports of possible candidacy from Rep. Ayanna Pressley.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox chief baseball officer Craig Breslow prioritizes acquiring a top starting pitcher to complement ace Garrett Crochet.
Boston targets free agents or trades for pitchers like Joe Ryan, Freddy Peralta, or MacKenzie Gore.
Red Sox also aim to enhance lineup power, potentially considering free agents like Kyle Schwarber or Pete Alonso.

title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara inducted into Hockey Hall of Fame for his achievements as a dominant defenseman with the Boston Bruins.
Chara signed with Bruins in 2006, captaining the team for 14 seasons and leading them to a Stanley Cup win.
Chara known for his record-setting 108.8 mph shot and playing the 2019 Stanley Cup Final with a broken jaw.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick reflects on his first season coaching North Carolina, describing the adjustment to college football as a learning curve.
UNC is currently 4-5 in the ACC, needing two wins from the remaining three games to match last year's record.
Belichick acknowledges needing to identify player strengths sooner; improvements helped UNC end a four-game losing streak.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots listed 15 players on the injury report ahead of Thursday's game against the Jets.
Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson participated in Monday's practice after missing Sunday's game with injuries.
Austin Hooper missed practice due to a concussion; other key players were limited with various injuries.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman, 44, from Atlanta, is charged with 25 counts, including larceny, fraud, and money laundering in Massachusetts.
Stayman allegedly stole $1.1 million and attempted to claim $2.2 million more from Massachusetts' unclaimed property division.
His co-defendant, Dwight Tucker, is due for arraignment, while Stayman faces federal charges in a separate Alabama case.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson hesitated during a touchdown run, looking for sideline guidance on whether to score or run down the clock.
Henderson's performance helped secure a Patriots victory over the Buccaneers, including surpassing 100 yards and scoring multiple touchdowns.
The Patriots are monitoring running back depth with Rhamondre Stevenson out and Terrell Jennings evaluated for injuries.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins lineup on Saturday, recording two assists in a 5-3 win against Toronto.
Lohrei was benched for five games due to defensive struggles, replaced by Jonathan Aspirot during a winning streak.
Head coach Marco Sturm's benchings have motivated other Bruins players, including Casey Mittelstadt and Marat Khusnutdinov.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners collecting signatures to repeal recreational marijuana in Massachusetts are accused of misleading voters about the petition's content.
The Coalition for a Healthy Massachusetts aims to gather enough signatures for a 2026 ballot question to make possessing over one ounce illegal.
Officials received complaints about misrepresentation; a cannabis advocate called the efforts 'organized voter fraud' amid allegations of deception.

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, a decrease from $10.26 billion in 2024.
UMass system leads with the top 15 highest-paid state employees, totaling $1.55 billion in payroll expenditures.
UMass Men's Basketball Head Coach Frank Martin is the highest-paid state employee, earning $1,955,216.
